bibl.title: Letter from Merritte W. Ireland to Howard A. Kelly, April 2, 1907

div1.p: Ireland writes that the New York Merchants' Association will offer assistance to Mabel H. Lazear. Ireland also discusses Kissinger.

div1.head: Letter from Merritte W. Ireland to Howard A. Kelly, April 2, 1907
div1.opener:
MR
m
WAR DEPARTMENT,
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL,
WASHINGTON.
April 2, 1907
Prof. H. A. Kelly,
1418 Eutaw Place,
Baltimore, Md.
My dear Dr. Kelly:
div1.p:
Thank you very much for
your letter of April 1st, which has just
been received. Strangely enough, Mr. S.C.
Mead, the Secretary of the New York Merchant's
Association, came into the office a few mo-
ments after your letter was placed on my desk.
He says that his Association will take steps
at once to ascertain Mrs. Lazear's present
financial condition, and he thinks it will be
able to render her material assistance.

Your information about
Priv. Kissinger is the first that we have re-
ceived relative to his present condition. I
shall take pleasure in sending a copy of
your letter to Major Kean, who knew Kissin-
ger very well.
